title: Password Reset Link issue

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

At the moment we don't see an immediate security risk in this and consider this accepted risk.

We'd like to encourage to keep hacking. We're looking forward to your next report!
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

At the moment we don't see an immediate security risk in this and consider this accepted risk.

We'd like to encourage to keep hacking. We're looking forward to your next report!

activities.message:
not any security risk? also added attacking scenario and other circumstances

There are many vectors where the factor remains about the attacker having access to at least something, And having access to the user's original email is nothing new i suppose.
Lately i have been clearly thinking about the likability of the attacks i am reporting, because at the end it is me who is loosing points here.

Let me explain, If a user is logged in to his account, why would he request a password reset link, moreover notifying him or doing a logout would mean that at least some suspicious activity has taken place.

activities.message:
We've discussed this internally again a team member has voted to [add this change as security hardening](https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/1024). This means it will be included in our next major release but not backported to older releases.

We do however believe that this does not meet the minimum requirements for a monetary bounty. We'd however be happy to provide you with some swag.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hello,
i found out about an issue in your password reset links and their expiration
Steps to reproduce:
Request a password reset link to an account
Login to the account afterwards
Logout and use the link to reset the password
The link would not be expired

Now i know that the links need to expire after a certain time, but thinking logically there is no point of keeping the link alive once the user has logged in, It indicates the possibility that the user's original email has been compromised and the attacker has requested the link, This way the user's account can be compromised.

Attack Scenario:
Attacker requests the password reset link, User logs in, Link does not expire even after that. The attacker can use the link easily. Infact requesting a link when the account is logged in from a location should be prohibited to prevent compromise

I think this should be fixed,
Thanks
vulnerability_information:
Hello,
i found out about an issue in your password reset links and their expiration
Steps to reproduce:
Request a password reset link to an account
Login to the account afterwards
Logout and use the link to reset the password
The link would not be expired

Now i know that the links need to expire after a certain time, but thinking logically there is no point of keeping the link alive once the user has logged in, It indicates the possibility that the user's original email has been compromised and the attacker has requested the link, This way the user's account can be compromised.

Attack Scenario:
Attacker requests the password reset link, User logs in, Link does not expire even after that. The attacker can use the link easily. Infact requesting a link when the account is logged in from a location should be prohibited to prevent compromise

I think this should be fixed, 
Thanks
